flawed_nl_solution:
Susan picked 3 times as much as 36 which is 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 apples
She gave out half which is 108*(1/2) = <<108*(1/2)=54>>54 apples
She now has 108-54 = <<108-54=45>>45 apples
Frank sold a third of 36 which is 36*(1/3) = <<36*(1/3)=12>>12 apples
Frank now has 36-12 = <<36-12=24>>24 apples
Altogether they now have 45+24 = <<45+24=69>>69 apples

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 54, not 45. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
